com.esri.mo2.src.cat
Class CatalogModel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.src.cat.CatalogModel
public class CatalogModel
extends Object

Defines a model for applications using a Catalog of Content objects. This model is pluggable via the ContentProvider interface. Several static methods are available for inserting or removing ConnectionProviders. The initialize method uses the Provider api to discover all ConnectionProviders defined by the plugin technology within the application CLASSPATH. initialize is invoked first time this class is accessed via a static initializer. Subsequent invocations may be used to update this CatalogModel, assuming the CLASSPATH is ever altered.

Applications can dynamically modify the contents of a CatalogModel by using the addConnection() and removeConnection() methods. A typical usage within a user interface is to open a dialog that displays connection parameters for end-user to enter and/or modify, and after end-user clicks OK, a new Connection object is constructed then added to this CatalogModel. When it is desired to disconnect the given Connection, it might be appropriate to remove the Connection from the CatalogModel.

See Also:
ContentProvider, Provider

Field Detail

PATH_SEPARATOR

public static final String PATH_SEPARATOR
all string paths are assumed to be separated using the system dependent file separator defined by System.getProperty("file.separator"). It is assumed that string paths are being used solely for platform-specific purposes, otherwise there may be cross-platform issues if these paths are serialized and used on multiple platforms.

Constructor Detail

CatalogModel

public CatalogModel()
Method Detail

initialize

public static void initialize()
discovers all ConnectionProviders defined by Provider plugin technology and loads an instance of each ContentProvider into the model. SUbsequently, each ContentProvider is requested to initialize().

Note: this method is automatically called when the CatalogModel class is first accessed. You only need to call this method if you want the model to be re-initialized, possibly if you know that new ContentProviders have been added to the classpath.

If an exception occurs when scanning the classpath for plugins, no plugin will be loaded. But if an exception occurs when attempting to load a particular ContentProvider, it will be ignored, and an attempt will be made to continue with the next ContentProvider (if any).

addProvider

public static void addProvider(ContentProvider provider)
                        throws IOException
add one ContentProvider to the collection of providers

Parameters:
provider - the ContentProvider to be added to the CatalogModel
Throws:
IOException - if any problem constructing the root folder defined by the ContentProvider
NullPointerException - if provider==null

removeProvider

public static void removeProvider(String connectionType)
remove a ContentProvider from the collection of providers

Parameters:
connectionType - the full class path for the type of Connection that the ContentProvider handles

getProviderCount

public static int getProviderCount()
obtain the number of ConnectionProviders for this Connection

getProviders

public static Iterator getProviders()
obtain a read-only iterator over the registered ContentProviders

getProvider

public static ContentProvider getProvider(String connectionType)
obtain the ContentProvider that handles the given connection type. For example
      ContentProvider provider = CatalogModel.getProvider(
                                      FileSystemConnection.class.getName());
 yields an instance of FileSystemContentProvider

Parameters:
connectionType - the full class path of the Connection class
Returns:
the corresponding ContentProvider, or null == no ContentProvider is registered for this connection type

getProvider

public static ContentProvider getProvider(Content content)
obtain the ContentProvider that constructed the given Content. This helper method obtains a Connection from the Content using Content.createConnection() then invokes ContentProvider.getProvider(String). Alternatively, if the Content also implements ProviderContent then the Provider is obtained from there instead.

Parameters:
content - the content for which a ContentProvider is needed
Returns:
the corresponding ContentProvider, or null == no ContentProvider is registered for this connection type

get

public static CatalogModel get()
obtain the singleton CatalogModel. Only one CatalogModel instance can exist within a single application.

Returns:
the singleton CatalogModel

performAction

public void performAction(ContentAction action)
perform a special action on the Content identified by the given ContentAction, typically for use by the user interface Catalog. This method tries to identify the Content's ContentProvider and if successful, delegates to ContentProvider.performAction(ContentAction action). Does nothing if the Content was not produced by a ContentProvider.

Throws:
NullPointerException - if action or action.getContent() is null

clear

public static void clear()
provide a way to clear the current CatalogModel, this method simply removes the current singleton CatalogModel. A subsequent call to get() will produce a completely new CatalogModel singleton.

getRoot

public Folder getRoot()
obtains the root Folder of this CatalogModel

Returns:
the root Folder

getProviderRoot

public static Folder getProviderRoot(String connectionType)
obtains the root Folder for the given connection type. This is determined by first finding the ContentProvider corresponding with the connection type then using the information there to obtain the relevant Folder.

Returns:
the corresponding root Folder, or null = no ContentProvider was found that handles this connection type

addConnection

public boolean addConnection(Connection connection)
                      throws IOException
add a Connection to this model. This method will first determine if connection is already represented in this CatalogModel. Nothing will be done if connection is already present. Otherwise, the currently registered ConnectionProviders will be searched to find if the Connection is supported by one of them, and to obtain Content from the identified ContentProvider to be inserted into this CatalogModel.

Parameters:
connection - the Connection to be added to the model
Returns:
true == successfully added or ignored, false == the Connection is not supported by any registered ContentProvider
Throws:
IOException - if any problem occurs constructing root Contents of the connection's Source

removeConnection

public boolean removeConnection(Connection connection)
remove a Connection from this model. This method will attempt to remove all Content relating to the given Connection from this CatalogModel. If the Connection was never added to this CatalogModel the return value will be false, otherwise true.

Parameters:
connection - the Connection to be removed from the model
Returns:
true == successfully removed, false == the Connection was never added to this CatalogModel

getCatalogPath

public static String getCatalogPath(Content content)
construct the full catalog path for given content. This is the path string that begins at the catalog root and is different from Content.getPath() which yields the path relative to the Source that constructed a Content.

Parameters:
content -
Returns:
the path

refresh

public void refresh(Folder folder)
             throws IOException
helper method, invokes folder.refresh() then signals a CatalogModelEvent having id == REFRESH

Parameters:
folder - the folder to be refreshed
Throws:
IOException - passed through from folder.refresh()

addCatalogModelListener

public void addCatalogModelListener(CatalogModelListener l)
registers the given CatalogModelListener to receive future CatalogModelEvents. The CatalogModelListener will continue to receive these events until it no longer exists (has been garbage collected) - see EventMulticaster to find out why GC is important.

See Also:
EventMulticaster

removeCatalogModelListener

public void removeCatalogModelListener(CatalogModelListener l)
Deprecated. In the future, this method will be removed.

See Also:
addCatalogModelListener(com.esri.mo2.src.cat.CatalogModelListener)

getContent

public Content getContent(String path)
                   throws IOException
obtain a Content for the given catalog path. It is possible to specify an empty of null path, in which case, the root Folder will be returned. It is not necessary to include the root folder's name in the path - you can specify it if you prefer, but it is optional.

For non-trivial cases, the path will be parsed using "new java.io.File(path)". This means the system default file separator will be used for parsing. The tree will then be traversed, starting with the root Folder. The path parsed will try to be matched with the tree. If the path matches a single Content object, then it will be returned. A null value will be returned if

  • a parent component within the path is not a Folder, or
  • any component within the path does not exist
For example, if the path specified is "/MyFolder/a/Mydata" and "/MyData/a" exists, but is a shapefile, and not a Folder, then null is returned.

Parameters:
path - the path of the required Content according to the above rules
Returns:
the Content, or null == no Content found for that path
Throws:
IOException - if there is any problem obtaining a Content from corresponding Source

isAncestorOf

public static boolean isAncestorOf(Folder folder,
                                   Content content)
determines if the given Folder is an ancestor of the given Content within this CatalogModel. folder is an ancestor of content if it is equal to content.getParent() or, by repeating the call to getParent() for every parent found, until folder or the catalog model root is found.

Parameters:
folder -
content -
Returns:
boolean, true if the folder is ancestor of content, otherwise returns false
